# Wait for PCG Data

Wait for PCG Components Generated output.

**How It Works**

> AI-Generated, needs proofreading

* The node waits for a specific PCGComponent to be generated by checking if an Actor reference matches the specified `Actor Reference Attribute`.
* It verifies that the `Template Graph` instance is set within the PCGComponent and its output has been generated.
* If `Must Match Template` is enabled, the node skips over any PCGComponents whose graph instances do not match the specified template.

#### Configuration

<details>

<summary><strong>Actor Reference Attribute</strong> <code>Name</code></summary>

Actor reference that we will be waiting for PCG Components with the target graph.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Template Input</strong> <code>PCGExDataInputValueType</code></summary>

Actor reference that we will be waiting for PCG Components with the target graph.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Template Graph</strong> <code>PCGGraph</code></summary>

Graph instance to look for. Will wait until a PCGComponent is found with that instance set, and its output generated.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Template Graph Attribute Name</strong> <code>Name</code></summary>

Graph instance to look for. Will wait until a PCGComponent is found with that instance set, and its output generated.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Quiet Actor Not Found Warning</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

Controls quiet actor not found warning.

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Quiet Component Not Found Warning</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

Controls quiet component not found warning.

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Quiet Timeout Error</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

Controls quiet timeout error.

</details>

**Filtering**

<details>

<summary><strong>Must Match Template</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, will skip components which graph instances is not the same as the specified template.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Must Have Tag</strong> <code>Name</code></summary>

If not None, will only consider components with the specified tag.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Do Match Generation Trigger</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

Controls do match generation trigger.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Match Generation Trigger</strong> <code>PCGComponentGenerationTrigger</code></summary>

If enabled, only process component with the specified generation trigger.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>â””â”€ Invert</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, only process component that do not match the specified generation trigger

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

**Gen & Wait Settings**

<details>

<summary><strong>Wait For Missing Actors</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, will wait for actor references to exist.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>â””â”€ Timeout</strong> <code>double</code></summary>

Time after which the search is considered a fail.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Wait For Missing Components</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, will wait for at least a single PCG component to be found that uses the target Graph. Use carefully, and only if you know for sure it will be found at some point!

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>â””â”€ Timeout</strong> <code>double</code></summary>

Time after which the search is considered a fail.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Grab GenerateOnLoad</strong> <code>PCGExGenerationTriggerAction</code></summary>

How to deal with found components that have the trigger condition 'GenerateOnLoad'

**Values:**

* **Ignore**: Ignore component if not actively generating already
* **As-is**: Grab the data as-is and doesnt'try to generate if it wasn't.
* **Generate**: Generate and wait for completion. If the component was already generated, this should not trigger a regeneration.
* **Force Generate**

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Grab GenerateOnDemand</strong> <code>PCGExGenerationTriggerAction</code></summary>

How to deal with found components that have the trigger condition 'GenerateOnDemand'

**Values:**

* **Ignore**: Ignore component if not actively generating already
* **As-is**: Grab the data as-is and doesnt'try to generate if it wasn't.
* **Generate**: Generate and wait for completion. If the component was already generated, this should not trigger a regeneration.
* **Force Generate**

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Grab GenerateAtRuntime</strong> <code>PCGExRuntimeGenerationTriggerAction</code></summary>

How to deal with found components that have the trigger condition 'GenerateAtRuntime'

**Values:**

* **Ignore**: Ignore component if not actively generating already
* **As-is**: Grab the data as-is and doesnt'try to refresh it.
* **Refresh**: Refresh and wait for completion

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

**Output**

<details>

<summary><strong>Ignore Required Pin</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, available data will be output even if some required pins have no data.

âš¡ PCG Overridable

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Dedupe Data</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, only output component data once per unique actor. Otherwise, output data as many time as found. Note that when enabled, TargetIndexToTag will be disabled.

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Carry Over Target Tags</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

If enabled, target collections' tags will be added to the output data.

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Target Attributes To Data Tags</strong> <code>PCGExAttributeToTagDetails</code></summary>

Lets you tag output data with attribute values from target points input

ðŸ“¦ See: AttributeToTag configuration

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Output Roaming</strong> <code>bool</code></summary>

Controls output roaming.

</details>

<details>

<summary><strong>Roaming Pin</strong> <code>Name</code></summary>

If enabled, adds an extra pin that contains all the data that isn't part of the template.

</details>
